snippet: In a case that has tested relations between Beijing and Seoul, the activist, Kim Young-hwan, has been under detention in China for more than two months.
abstract: Prominent South Korean activist Kim Young-hwan has been in detention in China for more than two months on charges of endangering national security; case is testing relations between the two countries; while China insists it is handling case according to its laws, South Korean officials condemn his detention as a violation of human rights.
lead_paragraph: In a case that has tested relations between Beijing and Seoul, the activist, Kim Young-hwan, has been under detention in China for more than two months.

headline.seo: South Korean Democracy Campaigner Is Detained in China
headline.main: Relations Tested in Case of South Korean Activist Detained in China
headline.print_headline: Relations Tested in Case of South Korean Activist Detained in China

keywords.value: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations
keywords.name: subject
